3nQHEPfTOniQTRsqrkXe_w.text: I have only been here once, but at least I had a burger and three beers, so I am totally qualified to review the place now! (Wisely, I let myself sober up completely before writing anything for a review.)  Actually the selection of interesting ales is nothing short of awesome, you are certain to find something you like. It has to be seen. The burger was all right, pretty good even. The look of the room isn't exactly jawdropping, but nothing to whine about. CASK is flirting with five stars, and I will try to get back there soon to give them a chance to fight for it!

N_bD5Zss9e6gZYLCtx0WiA.text: This Pub is brilliant. A real gem in the heart of quiet Pimlico :) such a good selection of beers!!!

G3xVUEcfmuCQknkYa0sZ5A.text: I am a Yank craft beer enthusiast.  Imagine my delight to find an Anchorage Brewing tap takeover plus a nice cask beer selection...all amidst a bluegrass jam session (and they were quite good, coming from someone who grew up in Virginia).  Food was great complemented by some unique sauces (Bloody Mary Ketchup?  Fantastic!) This place is a winner all the way round.

IufkbNQjCl6KKP6QcWBwgg.text: CASK had an upbeat vibe, great beer selection and good food. We arrived and were able to find a table. We went up to the bar to order, I got the hefeweizen and my boyfriend got the lager. We enjoyed both. We ordered two bacon burgers, one with the truffle oil fries and the other with the bacon dust fries. The burger was delicious and the truffle oil fries were the best. I would recommend this place to anyone! Just keep in mind that there is only burgers on the menu!

7PL9ovwr8g4ZH0_DdQMbTg.text: Popped in on a Thursday evening - excellent beer menu, selections from around the world and mostly smaller producers (the only place in Europe I've ever seen Racer 5 and some other CA micros). The staff is kind enough to allow one to try a shot before ordering a pint to make sure it is something you'll like.The food menu is very British pub food, and while I wasn't in the mood that day, it all looked great at nearby tables. It should be noted, there are only a few options for vegetarians - but there are some options.The space is very open, which means it is also very loud. Not a major issue, but certainly something to think about if you're planning to have a conversation.

XmIdKNycnKzAqNtQ3dhyDQ.text: Great craft beer selection. Burger and chips good but not close to great burger back home in the states. Attentive and friendly staff and easy going locals. Highly recommend for anyone living in or visiting London.

4G9lChBcRneKPo9gi3FEYQ.text: Pub was just OK. They have a great beer selection with more a craft beer offering which can be hit or miss. I had the American Psycho beer which I would not recommend and the Elvis burger which had peanut butter, fried banana and bacon. The burger sounded interesting to my stomach but if my brain had actually thought about this combo, it would have predicted how gross it would be. The scene is lively. A marketing guy must run the place as there are ads everywhere for the bar.

o0_NiEm1yLkC0slUDUGbQA.text: American in London for 9 days... on my second night I asked a local why all the pubs in London served the 5 same shitty beers: Fosters, Stella and 3 other bland beers... she told me I had to visit Cask.  She was an angel sent from God!!!  I told all my friends that had traveled with me that we were going to check out a "real London Pub"... so we got our shit together and went down to Cask.  We were overwhelmed by the Beer Bible they call a menu... we never ate, only drank our arses off, but what amazing beer it was!!!  I was a little disappointed by them closing so early, I believe 11pm, but I heard this was more due to British zoning laws.  I was good to go for another few hours, this place was that cool to just hang out and drink in, and tell funny stories and dirty jokes.  The beer of the trip for me was their Arbor Ale's 500 IPA... that's right, kids, they brewed hops into the beer for 500 straight minutes.  This is brewed in Bristol.  It was amazing.  The bartenders were super-friendly, let us taste different beers, one even let one girl take a glass that said "Cask" on it home to her boyfriend.  Super cool people.  The interior was super-sleek... the lighting was dim, warm and inviting.  Plenty of seating.  Gets busy late, so you'll probably be standing at somepoint, but enjoy the beer - that's why you're there!!!Best pub in my 9 days in London.

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. slick interior @ Cask

ubiuFKLHKadjM_Thcxt_eA.text: No doubt about it: this place rocks. Chief amongst its attractions is its extraordinary range of beer (in the region of 350 different types), including some leftfield choices you're extremely unlikely to encounter in your typical boozer (I'm gonna have to face it, I'm addicted to Mikkeller Beer Geek Breakfast) and which you can takeaway. Their food is also reasonable and though a popular Pimlico hangout, it's usually possible to get a table. The only criticism I've heard of it is from wine-lovers unimpressed with their viticultural offerings, but then this is a beer house first and foremost. My favourite pub in Victoria/Pimlico.

zFEbe4TBy75tAjUtEzbHcA.text: Loved this place.  So many beer options.  Other than the cask ales everything they had on tap was pretty much 10%.  My pint of black and tan was made with two 10% beers, and it almost knocked me over, it was beautiful.  Ask for the beer menu, or just ask one of the older guys behind the bar.  They know their stuff, and are happy to make suggestions.  Haven't tried the food yet - it doesn't look particularly spectacular, but you shouldn't go there for the food anyway...

6heikolKIfyy_57ZiAsHxg.text: This seems to be a very popular pub in London cause its constantly crowded. They have a massive selection of beers, some of them really weird, but its nice to try new stuff once in a while.The chicken burger was good (omg i ate a lot of burgers in europe) and the price was ok

HNPBxpdiFhdF8pQ8PHkwgg.text: CASK is a fabulous pub! Huge selection, tasty burgers and hence, inevitable great laughs. As a tiny downside, it's quite darkish inside and may be quite loud.

LywZT6Ju8pF9NvXkHQWeuA.text: Awesome delicious food!! Friendly staff! Cozy environment!! Highly recommend to anyone visiting the area! Huge beer selection too!

bmPyLbWYyMoCii2aJuIxMQ.text: The cider! If you only stop in this lovely pub for a pint of cider, you are doing yourself a huge favor. But while you're there you should probably also have a burger, some chips, and finish the night off with some craft whiskey. We tried this spot after reading some rave reviews, and our high expectations were not disappointed. Don't be afraid to ask the bar staff to recommend their favorite brews - they were helpful and very obliging!

aJqRh_CduP4vc0fcuMrhQA.text: The food seems ok (I've never had my own), but the beer is often not kept well - but there is a good selection on draft and in bottle. There are better pubs, but not in this part of Pimlico. Head up towards Wilton Road area for other ale pub alternatives.

o3tPLE3vqs_CcBzmaghEHA.text: Excellent beer and burger in a nice off the beaten track venue.  The chicken is/was free range and the beef was apparently raised for the queen so I don't know what she is eating.

Ll6XHaDdwDaqk9hTwyApNQ.text: As everyone has said this is a beer house and you should come for the beer. The beer menu was described as overwhelming and I actually didn't order any. Everyone else I was with did and were pleased with their selections. I ordered the food and it was decent for a place known for their beer. We had the nachos with beef and a hamburger with chips. The chips were amazing and I wasn't even drunk! But I like a good thick chip that is hot out of the fryer. The nachos started off ok, but if they aren't eaten fast get congealed under the weight of the chili, cheese and refried beans. Maybe if there had been 5 of us vs. 3 this would have been a good pick. We will be going back, my husband has assured me of that! And hopefully this time I will try one of the many beers!

ZaOP07sel_xIAxDc8ROlUg.text: Great beer, shame about the kitchen. Two disappointing burgers and several pints of amazing ale later, I will eat before I re-visit...but I will re-visit.

oPHMRigt2hy4jVPwXumTBw.text: We only ordered food and didn't try any of the beers and other spirits on tap. We ordered the burgers and found them to be wonderful. The ground beef was excellent and the tray of sauces was a great idea. The tray included a mayo, a couple mustards, and several steak sauces. If you have never been there before it may be helpful to know that you seat yourself, look over the menu, notice your table number, and head up to the bar to order. Once you have ordered, the food and sauces are brought to your table. I would say that the staff was fun and efficient.

T8mXROk2aE5WlW_c8frPpQ.text: Outstanding bar. Great selection of beers from UK and the United States. Excellent service. Will definitely return to this bar when I return to London.

b2UlIEcE-_URB6od8He5sQ.text: Plain & simple pub. If you want to have a good burger and a pint of beer, this is the place to be.

efWOy23WWgF90GCA5WgQ0A.text: Pre-Christmas drinkies (review is a little late) but this is a great pub. A little off the beaten track but worth making the incremental effort to get to this place.  So cold, grey London day and picked this place to meet a couple of friends. They have an excellent selection of ales, beers, and other fluids (whiskey, burbons and a reasonable wine selection too. Staff were friendly and helpful, more than happy to offer a sample of their tap beers to make sure you found the right one. I ordered a burger to satisfy the inner hunger, came out pretty quickly despite the place being quite busy, and was served with a generous portion of chips. When I'm back in the area I'll stop by for a pint or three!

kiwSUgf19wbClBgMND8ylg.text: A total gem!  During a week long trip to London, and having rented an apartment in the neighborhood, this was a welcome change from some of the other watering holes in town.  After researching pubs in advance of the one week trip, we stumbled across a New York Times article highlighting several pubs, including this place.  We were delighted to discover that it was no more than a five minute walk (or stumble) from our flat.  We never ate here, so my comments and rating revolve around the booze.  We made two trips to this joint while we were in London.The prices were quite fair considering the breadth of their offerings and the quality of the beers served.  The beers are priced based on their alcohol content.  There are a few menus available from the bartenders which go over the massive bottles selection that supplements the draft offerings.  I was delighted to see that Pretty Things out of Somerville MA had made the jump across the pond.  There was quite a strong selection of American micro- and craft brewers, though given the relatively easy access at home, I was tempted by the British stuff that might be harder to find.  There was a casual and cozy atmosphere to the place.  It got quite a mix of people, which added to the casual atmosphere.  The bartenders were quite knowledgeable about the beers and were happy to provide samples (trying before buying).  They were also quite good at providing recommendations based on your preferences.  Should my travels bring me back to London, I will definitely return.  The one drawback was the ~11pm close time, but that's not their fault.  Though I suppose that it's a good governor for my love of their selection of beers.

24vndSmxltWE5PVKloNxXQ.text: This place was great. Authentic English style pub with traditional English foods and ales. This was a place that you can hang out, drink & eat for hours.  I think we sat in here and people watched for 3 hours. Next trip to London, I'll be coming back here for sure! Outdoor seating upstairs too

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. It's like Mr Bean and Benny Hill had a baby.
Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Out front gives you that "traditional English pub" vibe

qYLsEj_N2XYe7SgXPXlcZw.text: If you're in the area and you fancy good beer, you will be spoiled for choice. The staff were really friendly and the food was good. It's just burgers on the menu, but the burger choices are excellent. I had a vegetarian burger that was very tasty. It was big enough that I ate it with a knife and fork. I love the big trough of sauces and ketchups and things to put on your burger and your chips.It's a short walk from the station. It gets crowded because it's good. My server was wearing a Fraggle Rock T-shirt and that amused me to no end.

QCDN-212Qd1WhwFHkThHew.text: Cask does a great job showcasing the UK's craft beer evolution in a comfortable setting with a staff that understands and care about their product.  The food is surprisingly good too.  I had the Portabella and Halloumi 'burger', which was quite tasty and the chips were well done.  Suffice to say, I spent 5 days in London at a hotel over a kilometer away, and I made it here every day.

g6ozkH4X-nGct4OvAT2DZg.text: One of my friends had to take a Euroline back to France so we didn't want to go too far from Victoria. So I used yelp to try and find us a nice place to eat and have one last meal/drink before she left - and we weren't disappointed.The staff was very friendly (even when we took quite a long time to decide what we wanted to eat). Their condiments were amazing: Bloody Mary ketchup and several delicious mustards (and I'm usually not very fond of British mustards but their honey mustard was spot on). We both got bacon & cheese burgers, which were lovely (just the right amount of cheese and not too salty). The sweet potato fries and the regular fries were both good and crunchy. They kept the food very simple and enjoyable.Their ginger beer is very good, not too sweet and very gingery. They have a great selection of ales and lagers and if you feel a bit lost (like I did!) the staff is helpful and gives good advice.In total I think we paid about £30 for the two of us, and had a lovely time and good meal. It was a weeknight and the place wasn't too crowded but still lively. Not the most original pub

LjhssOGZnRqe-wGqeladhw.text: Do not be deceived by the outward appearance of this pub.. I nearly didn't go in the first time I went there, call me overly cautious but I felt it had a 'locals only' kind of look! It is anything but though - I've met London residents who have travelled over an hour to get to CASK, it is THAT good.Bacon Chips, friendly staff and a selection of beers that would bring tears of joy to the eyes of anyone with the untappd app. If they have any - try The Kernal Centennial!

lMOjbe1IQtNqyWYMIyVCeA.text: Never heard of it till I was searching for food within walking distance of my hotel. Thank the gods I found this one!!! Biggest beer menu I've ever seen, some of the tastiest ones as well. I ordered the "Elvis", which was great. The peanut butter was a little overwhelming, though. Flavour was spot on though. Maybe they could use just a little bit less..? ANYwho, the food was great, the beers were better, and the environment was cozy yet open enough. They have a bluegrass band that plays every night at 1630-1930, which is amazingly entertaining. Overall, I love this place.

nThT7D4VtH2JUrKR7a-ehw.text: "That is a tasty burger". Pulp Fiction fans...you out there?These are some delicious hamburgers. Not overly done up. It's just really quality meat, bread and toppings. Oh, and the French fries? Top 5 French fries I've ever eaten. So damn crispy. How do they do that?Many cask beers on tap as well as bottles. I had two of their Bitter style brew. And, it wasn't just your regular old brew. Very tasty with a great finish. Unfortunately, I'm only in town for the night.  I'd recommend this to any friend and hide it from all enemies. I'd like to see a slightly enlarged menu. It's pretty limited. I get it, I get it. It's about the beer and burgers. Nonetheless, more menu items would be good.

N7zG-Z0s6WpFytvHNY5HFg.text: Unassuming place about 3/4 of a mile from our hotel.  Like any pub, gotta go up to the bar to order drink and food.  HUGE selection of beers, many in casks....and page full of beer in bottles (in 9pt type!).  Burgers were SPECTACTULAR!  I settled for th plainer 40 burger...with a  ton of condiments coming on the side.  My husband ordered The Heat....w Buffalo sauce and cheese.  It was beyond hot....he wiped his brow of sweat many times over.  Incredible enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Burgers n chips..."The Heat" is an exceptionally hot burger..,you'll need an extra pint.
Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Great condiments!

FMCSWZhN48YXiASbWFdSEQ.text: I think this could easily become one of my favourite "local" spots in London. The beer selection is so extensive that it's almost overwhelming - in a great way! You could easily spend a whole evening here trying different beers you've never heard of and not even make a dent in the menu. And that's only  the drinks. It's worth the trip over to Cask for their burgers too. I had a simple cheeseburger (topped with cheddar) and it was delish, perfectly cooked burger on a nice brioche bun with a side of chips - I cleaned my plate. Also, must mention the fantastic array of sauces! Alongside your usual tomato ketchup, mayonnaise and bbq sauce, also sat a bloody mary ketchup and honey mustard! Not just mustard, honey mustard.. I haven't been able to find that anywhere else in London yet. Just to note, Cask seems to get really busy for after-work drinks on Friday and also on the weekends, but it's pretty manageable during the week.

L0mqY8X3TyBQTh3YLZA4jg.text: If you're tired of the standard English pub selection of ales... If your friends say that English beers suck... If you're sober and you'd prefer not to be, with taste.. this is the place to go.We stopped in here after seeing a favorable review, and frankly, we were unprepared for the extensive beer selection to choose from (because it was noon, and we had places we needed to be.)  The beer selection was truly varied with different styles and regions represented.  The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful- the holy triumvirate for waitstaff.  When we ordered a beer no one in our party liked they even took it off our tab!  Additionally, I liked the location: it was spacious and comfortable.I highly recommend this place.

CvKY3ghT3l8qCYR1xqN03w.text: Good food for a decent price. Lots to chose from, when in London stop by

i9s62owHjqNfjhwieay12Q.text: We stayed in the neighborhood and wanted to try some different beers. What a great selection this place has!! They have a very big selection of the tap beer...if you are not sure what to choose, just ask the barman and he will help you with the selection. That was in my case..I told the barman what kind of taste I was looking for and he suggested one of the two beers..gave me small samples to taste them to help me to make a choice. You can go either with pint or half pint. If you feel hungry they have a burger menu..those looked delicious, but as we were after dinner, we just looked at the burgers being served on other tables and we salivated....

SxoV0i3S1LVDTqwrpn_aKQ.text: The stilton bacon burger was fantastic!This place had easily the best beer selection we tried in London.

EBFLtHKodHsny1n-YHU_pw.text: I will start by saying that the IPA and Pilsner we had were fairly tasty but that is where the good part ends.  The burgers were overlooked, even by British standards and the brioche buns were dry/stale.  The Cajun chicken sandwich was messed up by the kitchen and delivered without the adornments described on the menu as part of the sandwich - no bacon, no avocado, no mayo and no spinach.  Server neglected to give us water despite several requests. Go for the beers, maybe, but not for the food or service.

RP37sdWuDk-l_AEig-yFew.text: This place is the bomb diggity. Usually, if you go to a cask ale specialist pub and ask the bar tender to pull you a pint of something girly and not to strong, their face is overcome with a look that says "Piss off". But not here! They just give you random pints and all is well. Absolute gem in Pimlico.

c229OL_ydYbBnF-7FBBX6A.text: This is the only good burger place in all of London. I lived in London for 3 months this year on business, and this was the only place I would go when I needed a burger. The beef quality in England is very poor, but this place was amazing in comparison to the others. The bartenders are very friendly and have knowledge of the beer selection. There is also free live folk music on Wednesdays or Sundays that was really cool to go see.

lqtyP2ilTWNS6W78AEUUrA.text: Since I'm not much of a beer person, I can't really attest to how great the selection is BUT I had the best fruit beer ever here. I think it was raspberry flavor and I don't remember the name :( but you'll have to trust me on that one if you enjoy fruity beer like I do. Just ask the bartender! As for the food, it is definitely a tiny selection for the noms but that's because you're supposed to come for the beer and why expect a gourmet food menu in a pub when all you need is a good selection of burgers? I had the veggie burger (halloumi and mushrooms) and I really enjoyed it. It's like I went to an actual burger joint and not a pub! Also, they have chips with BACON DUST! Yep, I was pretty mind-blown too! These were pretty good but watch out for your clothing - because it's bacon "dust" you may be fooled by how tasty and fluffy looking it is, but get some on your blouse and b-a-m, you realize you're literally eating bacon..in dust form. Crazy.For a non-beer enthusiast, I was content that I was able to find a drink I liked and the food to satiate my hunger but I do think it's more worth the visit if you're here for the drinks and not the food (that is unless you're into the idea of bacon dust. Really. How come I can't find this in San Francisco.)

X4eMyXQROMgMwkd_z2hrfw.text: First dinner on this London trip did not disappoint. The menu is small and simple but delicious.

EqbGoRNf3-rHBeHrN6vNRA.text: We just had a glass of beer/cider, but I could already tell I'd like this place even for food. Our beer and cider were both fresh and tasty. The selection was varied and nice too, with plenty of different ales, ciders, etc to choose from. For food, they seemed to do burgers only. Although we didn't eat anything, based on observing what were being served at the tables around us, the burgers looked solidly done. Ambience is simplistic and yet, just casual and perfect enough for a relaxed evening. I'd definitely return for more beer and some. burgers!

2ghRJJy885Cm3ZNpdv8__Q.text: Perhaps the quintessential British pub.Cask features an amazing selection of craft ales, one that is rotated on a regular basis.  Those keg ales of this week will unlikely be there next month.  If you cannot find a delicious brew from their kegs, they've got bottled beer galore that will surprise and delight even the craft beer afficianados.Their burger are good eating.  Not great, but a solid 3/4 out of 5.  The chips are served with nice sauces, and the place is always bustling with activity.  Whether its the live music on Sundays, or just a place to meet up with your mates after a busy day at the office, this is the place to come.  Solid food, impeccable beer, this is everything a classic British drinking establishment ought to be.

V0G5CaVJK4uq4q7Oa2opVQ.text: Delicious beer and live music. A group of ppl were just jamming out in a circle on many diff string instruments. Not too loud and very tasteful. Great burger too. Tables could have been cleaned and washrooms were smelly.

LRDa64ZGAqtAm8UvAsO21A.text: Found ourselves in the neighborhood at a cancelled event. Disappointed, we searched around for a place to gave dinner. Cask totally came through. Tons of unique beers to try, delicious burgers and a lively, casual atmosphere. Place seems to be great for groups but wasn't so packed on a Friday night that we couldn't find a table. Highly recommend!

Cd5H0JMOgJAZn6SYLPTocg.text: Average burgers. Didn't try the beer, but I'm sure that would raise the review. Limited menu. Tried the 40, bacon cheese and cheese. The burgers were over cooked and almost tasted like they were pre-cooked and steamed to serve. They lacked that good burger taste.  I would try other more traditional pub before going back. Lacks the setting of nearby pubs that offer the same fare. If I go back, I'll have to wash the burger down with a beer.

9Xvgj4xtYqZqstEckzuLeg.text: Wow! The Cajun chicken burger was astonishingly good. Chicken was perfect. Tender, juicy and topped with bacon, avocado, baby spinach, mayo and Gruyere cheese. Damn. My brother had the Forty burger and his wife the Cluck which they both enjoyed immensely. Fries were awesome too. I did the parm and truffle oil fries. Totally addictive and totally recommended. Top it all off with a couple of great beers from the tap (a nice citrusy one called Saison L'ete and an APA called Gamma Ray) and that's 5 stars in my book.

PU2ZsOA-dHHbNnesT3zobQ.text: In terms of beers this place is a good spot.However we came here to eat and have drink. I was happy with the beers we had good selections.The burgers where marginal overall. We had the Elvis, which was a heavily covered burger with peanut butter and bananna. The peanut butter took over the burger entirely leaving little room fir tasting the actual burger.We got the bacon dusted fries. SGAIN Nothing special.Ww went to honest burger this week as well and was so much better.

zJaR84rbbvycEryJsAT3Dw.text: The locals seemed to like this place, and we did, too, overall. It's on a corner in a cool, somewhat modern, building and doesn't have the dark, cavernous feel of a traditional old pub. A block off a bustling retail strip. Nice selection of cask ales, but I have to say the two we ordered seemed a little flat (I'm familiar with them and more than expected). The service was fast and friendly, but you do order from the bar and they bring the food out to your table, or so it seemed. Limited vegetarian menu.

p6OBDrbUtK5uLD-uNQwD-g.text: While the rest of London dismally attempts to recreate the 19th century local pub with all the disneyland-esque charm head office can manage, this place puts all their chips in and bets the farm on what they think really matters at a pub... the beer. You will not find a better selection in London.Also the limited menu items available from the kitchen downstairs are held to a complementary high standard as the frothy goodness rotating on the dozen or so taps.

0sKQMmEI39tnCmI5fnBbJA.text: Great beer. LOTS of beer. And the food provided by Forty Burgers is cracking. If you've never had a Forty Burger you're missing out, honestly!CASK I believe is part of a small chain of CAMRA recommended pubs. They must have over a hundred different beers available at any given time and they are regularly changing the selection.The staff are friendly and knowledgable about their products and tasters are always available. Beers come in pints, halves and thirds and prices are determined by the alcohol percentage of the beer.If you've got a CASK near you or even not. Get yourself there. It's like a beer festival every day!

LTO6QMHIzM1PqTYXORzQGw.text: Meh.  I thought the atmosphere was a bit soulless.  If you are going there you are having burgers and fries which are fine but not amazing.I must admit I wasn't drinking that day so didn't get to sample the beers, but I wouldn't go running back there just to try them.

3davkDHN9CVqhyJrHD6ozA.text: Huge beer selection, live music in Sundays, and burgers from 40 Burgers upstairs. There seems to be a slow turnover in patrons which speaks to how much the place can pull you in.Super happy with my experience here.

4dWi14PryUTNR8vD3sSZUw.text: I visited this place twice in London.  In three days.  You could say I was impressed.Really interesting spot to check out the craft beer movement in the UK.  They had the first beer brewed in the UK with Citra hops, a cask ale that was delicious.  Also had English versions of an American IPA, a Berliner Weisse, and a barrel aged imperial stout, all excellent (especially the Berliner Weisse).  The killer was an imperial stout aged in Jameson barrels, Ger'Onimo  by Beavertown.  Not cheap, but better than buying a bunch of crap at the duty free with my leftover pounds.Besides English beers, there were a couple taps of Stone and three taps of Evil Twin (I had to partake in a Yang).  Bottle selection was very good, strong sour representation (variety of Cantillon, 3 Fonteinen).I had a burger with Stilton, very good, but the star here is the beer.In terms of ambiance, I was here with on a Wednesday afternoon and a Friday night.  Wednesday afternoon was very sleepy, there were six people total in the place.  A good place to chat in peace.  Friday evening was very busy, but in a good way.  And unlike a lot of beer bars in the US, a good ratio of women to men.  And attractive ones to boot.I spoke with one of the guys tending bar, Darren, for quite a bit.  Super knowledgeable about beer, really good to hear about the scene in London.  Learned a few bits of trivia as well (like Green Flash is brewing West Coast IPA out of St. Feullien in Belgium, crazy!).  Great fellow at a great bar.

OhfHwirUGzmsjEnl9l1hiA.text: I came to the CASK Pub and Kitchen on a soggy Monday night, even though the weather was inclement the pub was surprisingly packed and we were lucky to find a table at which to sit.The beer menu is extensive with over 350 different types to chose from however the general busyness of the place sadly means that the staff have to devote less time to the individual customers. The Kitchen part of the name gets mixed reviews but this is beer pub not a gastro pub.

Luh7aKDjhoM2hmGiFN_cmg.text: Great spot!  Open and airy - a bit different from traditional English pubs. Great menu - including a portobello hamburger for those who are vegetarian (really enjoyed it). The beer list is extensive and the bartenders are not only willing to give you suggestions, but try anything on tap. Overall great service. Lots of locals....fun to hear all the English accents - definitely adds to the charm. They also have a few spots outside to sit. Put it on your crawl list!

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

Jl5xbtpfJgwXR176JGDmCA.text: Nice place away from all the "tourist" places on the main streets.  I felt right at home as the staff was nice and friendly.   Great selection of beers on tap and the guy minding the bar was helpful.  Food was awesome.  My wife is very picky about her beef and she was impressed with the hamburger. Cooked just right.  The chips were excellent and we think they were the best on our trip to London.Next time I'm in London, this will be my first stop.

HTBsRZWSwiiMzqCxS7ONRw.text: Perfect!We were staying in a hotel near and searched for some good burger and ale... and found that great place on the internet. The burgers were fantastic, we had cheeseburger with cheddar and one with bacon and cheese.We only managed to try the draught beers, we were four and couldn't make it through the whole range of tap beer. And there is a huge menu of bottled beer as well!It was sunday so music was playing too! Perfect day out!

Vf9sLeGy70eiUdeAlkkF3A.text: Cask rides a strange line between bar, restaurant and pub, and somehow manages to please everyone in the process.  Whether you're a fan of craft beer or not, you're sure to find something in their vast selection to keep you sated all evening (I'm no beer drinker, but enjoyed their cider and strange fruity ale), and if you decide to try their burgers, you're sure to not be disappointed - not mind blowing, but good, affordable, well portioned food.  It's also surprisingly empty, which is a pleasure on weekends.

zxOrzMTN8c2bJDZeQN1p9A.text: If you are into gourmet burgers, any choice is a winner for you. You will enjoy the sides with great souces, such as Bloody Mary Ketchup (it has some vodka in it, and tastes exactly like Bloody Mary), Honey& Mustard etc.. Oh, dont forget to grab their craft wheat beer for that amazing meal. You're welcome!

CrE2V0Vd8r9wh6gEnyOXOw.text: Food and beer might be great but on May 1, 2018 mid afternoon we couldn't get any one of the four people on duty to wait on us. Got up and left.

ORHize1a7keNq6NCoKmEsg.text: About 4000 miles for lunch and some good beer....well maybe not all that way here just for Cask, but it actually might be worth it. Holly was amazing. A local craft beer encyclopedia with a smile. I'm writing this before I even get my food. Okay, food and beer now both consumed. Decent burger and really good fries. I'll close by saying just go see Holly and enjoy some beer.

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Veggie burger, cheese burger, Peel Orbit Session Blonde, and Kernel Pale Ale

zx2jz3d9acdTf2aSdHpsPw.text: What a varied selection of beers?  they have it. What a taste burger?  They have it.Want to meet your mates?  come early as the tables fill up!Had some great beers here so a definite plus.  The sweat potato chips (fries) are very good.  They have some interesting spicy on them that totally makes them way better than traditional chips.  I had the cheese burger and it was very good.  Nicely done and very tasty.  My DC just at the regular burger and it was ok.  It really does need the cheese.  One thing that was cool is some of the sauces that you can try out.  Highly recommend the bloody mary catsup.  A bit of a kick.  Be sure to have a friend grab a table while you go order.  as this place fills up fast!

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Swap the chips for the sweet potato ones.  The have a great seasoning.
Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Cheese with cheddar
Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

ec1axZ7byLnE9ZJ5nHBZdg.text: Spacious inside, few locals there but I was just before closing so it was pretty dead (Monday night also didn't help).. bartender was friendly and poured me a nice pint of their brewed beer which was tasty. Wish it had been a busier time to really see it shine and get some food.

NbSfni--VnANvu43RFM7kQ.text: If u are near and like beer and burgers.  Just go.  It's fantastic.  Bloody Mary ketsup and command mustard pushed it over the top. B

7clhm1cNxkPKwE9p6EZ6SA.text: Found this place while needing a late night meal. It was still serving food and had a great specialty burger menu. The food was great and the craft beer selection was awesome too.

mHEF35c3PBqc-UrIzKRINg.text: Their web site states that they take reservations on Sunday eveningsWe made a reservation.They sent us a "confirmation".Arrive to find that they will not honor the reservation and the "confirmation" was for their email subscription.Very poor marketing gimmickOnce we finally got a table, beer and burgers were good.

Al0lknlOPuUnj_CRFE0j2g.text: The bacon cheeseburger I got was really good. The beef tasted of high quality and I really enjoyed my meal. The fries that came with it were really good too. They also had a large variety of beers to choose from. The two I had were very tasty. I highly recommend this place.

Me5bHt5iNTeQ1pCUOrVAQg.text: Found this great pub via Yelp..another great example of Yelp is amazing :-) You really have to know where to look when finding this place as, from the outside, it doesn't look like a pub. It looks like a corner store. The atmosphere really isn't that cosy, it feel more like a Wetherspoons. Along with the type of people that attends such places. The seat are hard and the decor is rather boring. They also do not serve ANY hot drinks. No coffee, tea, etc. BUT, what makes this place great is the beer and the burgers. They have SO many beers and great staff that will tell you all about them :-) I had a sweeter on that was aged in a white wine barrel. The burgers, are okay. They're more fun than great. Thus my 4 stars. Overall, this is a fun place to go to for a very chilled afternoon. I would not recommended this place for a business meeting or a romantic night out. I would recommended it for a group of good friends that is looking for something different and to enjoy great beer with decent food :-)

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Great burgers,  great beer :)

FYI6vKPZK4CEjRYXR_mUiw.text: This is a solid pub with a variety of cask and bottle beers. I suggest getting there early because some tables will be reserved depending on the night. I can't speak to their food, but if you like to throw a few back and sample different flavors this is your place. There's comfy seating throughout and relatively quiet until everyone meets up after work for a  post-work cocktail.  I can speak to their food, but I did see a few plates come out of the kitchen and they looked and smelled delicious!

tpaRRDtMjnsVhDff0Rn7kA.text: The FH and I were craving some craft beer and were a little intrigued about the craft beer scene in London. Upon arrival, the place was not packed (which we both appreciated), and the bartender was very attentive. They had too many IPAs for my liking  (but let's be honest, one ipa is one too many for me lol).We both ordered local craft beers. I got a milk stout called Millionaire by the wild beer co which was amazing! And, also tried export stout london 1890 by the kernel brewery, this was good but not as good as the previous one.If we're ever in the area, we will definitely visit again!Being from San Diego, we were very happy to see Alesmith, Lost Abbey and the Bruery well represented in their menu :)

k_uaaoyJlGV-KcVbVich5g.text: CASK Pub and Kitchen surprised me in many ways... I'm impressed!It's located in a quiet-ish area in Pimlico but be warned - it's definitely not quiet inside! It was surprisingly busy on a Friday 17:30. The bar staff was really helpful and friendly when it came to deciding on beers. I had the Pheasant Plucker cider and it was everything I ever wanted (and more). It was sweet and just really easy to drink. I also had the Heat burger which was good but not amazing. They also give you a huge tray of condiments... Which blew my mind (the honey mustard mayo especially). If I were rating the burger alone, I'd give it 3 stars. I didn't like the texture of the patty. It was too dense for my liking.  The delicious blue cheese and buffalo sauce almost made up for the weird patty. Overall, great pub with amazing beer selection. I will definitely returning but not sure if I'll order the burger again.

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Left drink is Pheasant Plucker
Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. The Heat

8fNR03pio7T9UMLRwzNe_Q.text: The family and I were in London recently and heard great things about CASK Pub and Kitchen.  However we came on a Saturday and were told that no children are allowed after 17:00.  Beware Americans unfamiliar with local laws.

kBooRidaTSOChaLrEnKVBA.text: Sometimes the line between a pub and a bar can be a little blurred. The Cask looks like a corner shop from the outside but is spacious and comfortable inside with the feel of a modern bar. As you might expect from the name, it boasts an impressive range of cask ales which are priced according to strength. They verge on the pricey side but are fair for the location and are not extortionate. I hear that the burgers are impressive although I just enjoyed a couple of pints on my visit. There's a good selection of craft beer on keg if that's your bag and some interesting bottled beer too. The barmaid was friendly and welcoming. This place is well worth checking out if you're in the vicinity.

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Blissfully quiet on a weekday afternoon

JDb7qUYCIR5r_EKkx0bTcA.text: After my full first day in London (non-jetlagged), after wandering around what seemed to be 16 museums, I needed a beer.  A delicious, dark beer.  Oh and a burger.  Naturally I had bookmarked CASK as a stop, not only for the raves, but also because it was close to my hotel.  Because, drunk priorities.  I came in and was a little unsure of where to go, as I am a stupid American.  Like, really really dumb.  Thankfully the beer behind the bar beckoned me and I was able to order an Old Moor Porter and a burger.  I sat down at one of the many open tables (early-ish on a Monday evening so it wasn't too full yet).  The burger was quite delicious and I seem to have rated the porter a 3.5/5 on untappd.  While I would definitely recommend to beer lovers everywhere, one star because I feel the service could have been improved.  It wasn't raining, nobody was bleeding, so why the sour faces of the staff?

IhlCia9qE07Sl4R5fbYhvA.text: If you're looking for a good time, this is the place to go. We went last night & loved the live music. We never expected it to find a bluegrass band in London, but here's the place. If you're looking for great food, though, this shouldn't be your first choice. I had an Elvis burger that included strips of bacon & peanut butter & fried bananas. Interesting but not great.

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Bluegrass music in a London pub--who knew?

Ht3X5BNqxocJ-WZXfzyHnA.text: When we came in 6pm on Thursday this place was so busy. We could see this was the place we were looking for based on the large numbers of people standing on the sidewalk drinking, almost spilling into the street. There are probably 3 tables to sit at outside the rest is inside. About half the people here were standing. Tons of beers. Full bar. Hamburgers are very big and come with a side of fries. Hung out with her husband for 2 hours and had a blast. Would definitely come back.

BnvrpCAidIuSH3QSvBJgng.text: Yep, since we only had one choice for a (too) brief layover in London, this place hit the mark. Walking distance from our hotel, it had a delightful selection of beers and ales. The man behind the bar (Peter, who it turns out is co-owner of this and several others) listened to my request, pondered the choices, then provided a sample of his suggested selection. He was patient and thoughtful, and I was quite impressed with his knowledge and attentiveness to what I wanted. We tried several beers and ales, including one that I hope to find in the states (a Belgian that set the bar to a new height.) Food selection was limited, but was delivered fresh and delicious. I look forward to our next visit!

qole7gSGVASXzgXeTJtQFw.text: Nice pub. Great selection. Lots of their bottled beers are from CA too, I took it as a sign they know good craft beer.  Very relaxing place

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Over 2 dozen craft beers on draft.

PrB86VaVDZRMKGnox7RVFQ.text: Don't be put off by the souless decor this place has soul at its core. .... passionate people focused on delivering great beers and outstanding burgers.If you have a spare afternoon to go chill and sample then this is a great place.Enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Draught menu

HtTm723v9AXehr3RM5yApA.text: We were in London for only four nights, and we came here... three times!  Yes, after touring all around England and finding mostly pleasant but unremarkable ales, we found Cask by searching Yelp and what can I say?  We found our people.I couldn't tell you everything we sampled here, but suffice to say we enjoyed much of what we did try from their extensive taps, and appreciated the knowledgable staff.  One half pint my husband ordered for me that I did not care for was quickly swapped out for something else, no problem.  It's nice to get short pours, especially with the stronger beers, and try several.  Good hamburgers, and the salad was delicious as well.It got rather crowded as the evening wore on, and noisy.  I'd recommend going early, or you may have difficulty finding a seat.  The weather was lovely when we visited and were able to enjoy the outside seating, but even that got full quickly.  They are going to have to expand, and soon!

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

Jb-nKtriwB9Z8-V0u7g_gg.text: Great bar featuring a nice selection of craft beers from the UK. It's nice to switch it up if you're looking for something besides Fuller's beers. The place also has a good selection of bottled beers, including Cantillon and Hanssens sours (winning!). They also have a pretty solid list of American beers, if you're looking for that. Since we're also about trying local beers, we had a couple from Neptune Brewing, all of which were good. They do half-pours as well?Good service with a local crowd. The burgers looked good, but didn't eat so not sure taste.Seating might be hard to come by during busy times. They have a live band on Sunday evenings! Must visit for any beer fan in London!

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Cantillon available!
Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Beer and music

98jae15JlrhxphzfSx6j9A.text: Great beer selection and decent burgers. The location is a little out of the way if you aren't already in the neighborhood But it's a cool spot. Prices are good. You won't leave disappointed.

y6OaxEZ6PBR0JiSh63tqYA.text: This place is for real craft beer geeks and all others as well. Peter when above and beyond to get the beers that i need out of the "warehouse" even though the were busy. Had a few other beers as well and all were tasty. Customers i met there were also fun to chat with/listen to me ramble about sour beers :)

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Peter went beyond to accommodate. Thanks again for a memorable moment.

vuzM3ObZk38IEcya0jFcOg.text: Really eager to try this place since we were staying nearby, but it's not kid-friendly. Tried to bring my family here for dinner at about 20:00 on a Friday night, but we were asked to leave. Since food is served, it turns out that it's totally legal to have accompanied kids here before midnight: morningadvertiser.co.uk/…So I guess it comes down to a landlord wanting to maximize the profit on every seat in his pub. Too bad...we spent £68 on a fine meal at the nearby Marquis of Westminster instead. Wonder how that amount would rate here?

OgkgDfXtACu9BqWygrsYmA.text: Great beer selection.  Tasty food that focuses on quality and it shows through the taste and texture.  You can't pick the temperature for your hamburger (all of them are cooked well done) and it's a bit pricey.  Definitely for a casual special occasion with friends and family.

YImNsiXeI1mLsHe0nkbl-Q.text: CASK had the most impressive beer selection during my last trip London blowing The Craft Beer Co. out of the water. There was an extensive bottle list with options easily perused in the stand-alone refrigerators. The keg and cask selection was nicely curated with probably 20 choices, all from top breweries. Beers were served in correct glassware, at the correct temperature, and tasted fresh and well cared for. Pint prices were a touch high, but you are getting a better product. I did not try the food, but it looked great. If you are a beer enthuisanst, put this at the top of your list!

2-mThuPNV19DXKMGMGKfxQ.text: As a long time visitor to The Cask, this review is long overdue.  As I often work in the area, this is absolutely one of my favorite places to visit when I'm in London.  Peter and the rest of the staff are absolutely fantastic.  Their beer and food offerings are unparalleled.  In the innumerable visits over the past 8+ years, I have never once had a poor experience.  Sunday afternoons with live music is an especially fine time to visit.  If you are a lover of fine beer, good pub food and a lively atmosphere don't hesitate to make your way over to one of the finest craft beer pubs in London.  Cheers!

Ijw3QmZ5sa08IrkNBRncLQ.text: Great place for Beer and a quick bite. Burgers are awesome and beer selection is abundant for all taste!

U3fKiK0g4V2aZH0AK3wexw.text: Fantastic burgers and chips! Great beer selection and helpful bartenders. Would absolutely go again!

QpWNQd1LbIEZhKgSXJxEbQ.text: Great beers and food!!  Looking for local atmosphere.  This place is great!  After our first full day walking around London we needed a pub with great local craft beers.  And...good food!  Stop in and you won't regret it.

uC9oQ_Rzn1wL8grZmjZNeA.text: My husband's words exactly - One of the top 3 burgers I have ever had.  Beer was fantastic.  We spent dinner talking with the owner of a microbrewery in Beijing, he was from Toronto.  Great night out.As for me, I loved my burger too!  You definitely feel more like you're away from the crowds & in more of a local favorite hangout.

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

lo7OaoUDSzlTliy1jNj_dg.text: Had a few hours in London and found this pub by Yelp. Great selection of tap beers and IPA which I was looking for. Nice and great service. I went early so not that much people which was ok. Highly recommended if you look for great beer.

BYpe1jI-xsfRZiLgJZiMEA.text: The waitress was very nice, and people seemed to enjoy the place. It was filled up with young people drinking beer when we got there for a late dinner on a Tuesday evening. We had two different kind of beers - because they did not have enough to give us two of the same kind, but that was okay. My problem with this place was the food. The fries were good and could be served alone as snacks beside of the beers. The burger was terrible. Like one of the worst I have ever had. We ordered cheeseburgers and there was almost no cheese in either of them. The beefs were drier than a dessert in the summertime. Nothing was great about it. They never came to ask if everything was fine. I regret that I did not take any pictures, but it was so tasteless and dry that we just wanted to leave the place.

YTvdpKS5B9N5am_4umTzWA.text: Fantastic beer menu, and the food is great. The  chicken sandwich was awesome, and the whole vibe is great for American beer douches looking for the familiar feeling of taprooms. For added bonus, try to go when the bluegrass band is there, it's super casual and great background music.

EzuRNycuY9Cjm5V5ZSbJcQ.text: Traveled over from Fl on a work trip and looking for a burger found this place on yelp.  Great choice

GRZzqEfOugR7Tu2HdHzDZw.text: Best beer list in London! They have a lot of options both on the keg line and by the cask...not to mention the hundreds of bottles they have! Their takeaway deal is great for the bottles. As for food, their heat burger is outstanding! I mean who wouldn't love a whole burger smothered in hot sauce?!?!? And their truffle fries are worth upgrading to!

tZjMsscfb9dKjkZNPSVwuQ.text: Great ale selection and awesome food...Too bad the manager (Mr. Slezak) harassed me at the end of the night trying to get in my pants. Very unprofessional and nearly criminal!! Watch out if you end up going there

WbUqF_tNUhNRwR8zPujj_A.text: Great beer and exceptional chips! This was the first stop my sister and I made after arriving in London because it was just a couple of blocks away from our Airbnb. We stumbled upon it by accident and we were so happy we did! It's a cute little pub with friendly staff and a nice beer selection. And the fries (chips!) were amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

4fFigfSPZ33vWVoPFwHWHg.text: Popped in on Easter Sunday based on Yelp reviews and was not disappointed. They had a set menu with only four offerings but the food & service were spectacular!! Glad we stumbled upon this gem!

photos.caption: Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Roasted half chicken with roasted veggies
Photo of CASK Pub and Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Lamb roasted veggies and York pudding...

JfO5NcdbLLxtO1JVGxAz8w.text: Worth the 5-10 minute walk from Victoria Station. Always a beer on to catch the eye. I keep wanting to try the obscure lagers that are on tap but never get around to it. Then there is the umpteen bottles of various foreign beers. Do you know, I think I could live here.

LuHBFOlJJSiRcty59yayJA.text: Never knew the Pimlico Tram incarnation, but god to see that Cask is getting steadily more popular as word spreads. Very well kept real ale, a landlord who knows his beer, an excellent range of bottled beers, and good food. Ambience is lighting turned down low, and background music that is unobtrusive. Worth making a detour to get to if you like your real ale or German/Belgian beers.

moKyHBEEzThowFi43gi3mg.text: Great pub with delicious food and a truly impressive beer selection on tap and in bottles...looks a bit unprepossessing from the outside but is spacious and chilled on the inside. Well worth a visit - this has rapidly become the best pub in the area.

B6i_Yk4NMlejDuGtdhpylw.text: Thank you, Cask, for the best beer and best dinner we had during our whole honeymoon! The atmosphere here is relaxed and welcoming. Even though the owner ws quite busy, he still found some time to chat with us about his business. I wish there was something even close to this in the US, but, sadly, it seems that Cask is in a league of it's own.Fantastic!

q7mfz1dGZuC5AU_fHK5wgg.text: Beer selection was big but couldn't find what I liked and the bartender wasn't as creative helpful as I expected...

zujoVamXav_iMKQMMYvoUQ.text: When I travel on business to London I usually stay at a hotel in this neighborhood, so I frequently find myself gravitating to this place after work. The selection of beer is amazing. It can be difficult to make your way to the bar as this is quite popular with the locals after work as well. It can get noisy making it difficult to carry on a conversation. I have found that their food is a cut above your typical London pub; I especially like the burgers! The staff are very friendly and helpful; ask for a taste of any of their draft beer if you can't decide. Service is always quick.

QE8sd_P441OKq_3pevPE0w.text: An amazingly dense menu of drinks in a nice venue with a fantastically well-curated, perfectly supplementing selection of snack-type meals to order on the side. Would highly recommend.

f33PpQauitaMBMj1asN9HQ.text: You don't expect to find something this good here! Even when you find the venue, unless you know what to expect, you should find yourself pleasantly surprised. With half a dozen ales and a similar number of foreign beers on tap they have a selection of drinks that is hard to beat, I just wish they were a little bit cheaper. It is fair enough when a 10pc beer is about 6 pounds a pint (best to stick to halves anyway), but for a five point something percent Oktoberfest beer from Germany this seems well over the odds, despite the rarity. Luckily I was accidentally undercharged, which means I can hardly complain or deduct a star. :)

HykIJVOZ4pv-sR6PxLWXpA.text: Solid pub, but I'm not sure I got the same impression that others got. The selection sure was great, but it was still much smaller than I had expected, given what others have been saying. I may come back and try again, and I personally don't need every beer ever brewed to be in the same room as me for me to be happy, but Cask will have to prove itself furher to me before it earns that 5th star.

tQOMfQRRSTQtjnRAMkkngQ.text: I have absolutely no reason not to give these guys five stars. They can have all of my stars. I've been wanting a decent pub in Victoria for so long, but I always end up in the rubbish ones. This one is only five minutes away from the station, but it's FANTASTIC. They have a mix of real ale and Belgian beers on, both of which are good. Not too pricey either. I had an ale which was very hoppy so decided to switch (one more and I'd have fallen on the floor). My friend was instructed to get me a light ale that was less hoppy than that one. He came back with something that looked like Engine Oil. A nice enough pint, but not to my tastes. Still, we swapped drinks and all was good. There's an outdoor seating area for the smokies. a friendly local vibe and I think they do food too. The barmen were also pleased when I told them that the ladies loos were a bit of a mess. But then I wondered if they thought I'd messed them up... If you're in the area, you should come here. It's a great little boozer, full of local charm and happy vibes. And strong beers that will get you really really tipsy.

1Aw9O76inCCCtI4ZCIa1dQ.text: I tried to buy beer from Uto over in Borough Market. Sadly they did not have the beer I sought, however, they told me about this little gem tucked away on an inconspicuous corner in Pimlico - walk past and you might just miss it.The selection of beers is phenomenal and the friendly staff make selecting a beer an easy task. They also do solid nosh. Plan to have one or two here in the summer as there is (limited) outside seating.

S5fomrXrnHgl1QQGzKa5Lg.text: Their selling  point is the interesting beers they sell - they have a rotating selection on tap and big boards displaying all the ones that have featured in the past. So - boys  (and girls) into their speciality  beers will love it.I feel it falls down on the atmosphere. You can see they've put effort into giving the place a makeover but the space is just not very cosy or conducive to settling in for more than one drink. But, that's just my very subjective opinion. Give it a go as you might find different and there's no doubt they're putting in 100% to making this place a success

IOZH_NNxJO5ASRMB37Pluw.text: Nice and small pub in London. We found it, because we liked to drink some ale in London. Since the pub was not far away from our hotel, we went there to have our drink, and we were surprised. The pub is comfortable and furnished in comtemporary style. The seats have pillows and the tables are not too close together. Enough space to talk to each other. They did not only have Ale. We also found German and Belgian beer. They have got beer from all over the world, and the best: beer from my Bavarian home ;-) The meals were simple and good. Because the kitchen was being refurbished, only sandwiches and burgers were available at that time, but then! We had a Scottish burger and it was one of the the best burgers I've ever had. (Meat even better than at Space Burger in Düsseldorf/Germany). The service is very friendly and so are the guests. Next year I am visiting this place again, when we go to London!

5YGqxynKARiYq8qB4IfQeA.text: Yesterday I was in the neighborhood and wanted a good place to have a quick lunch with my friend. I checked QYPE and found this awesome pub. We were very happy with our choice  they have a wide selection of beers and the chicken burgers were crispy and delicious. Recommended!

6E-gZfpqWMhlfEVQ1HT0ag.text: This was the exact pick-me-up we needed after a trans-alantic flight: a nap, a cheeseburger and beer. I'm not yet fully qualified to review all the wonderful beer features this place seems to offer but I'm impressed with the selection! My wife and I both had a pint of  Rothaus wheat beer, which was delish, and a fat burger with swiss cheese. The gentlemen behind the bar were welcoming and patient with our slow American ways. :)We definitely will return to enjoy some of their wonderful liquid fare.

inSAr0-S7zlQtHnGTyv6lw.text: Our Christmas party was here, I'm nicely surprised. The service was good and the variations of beers is amazing. I tried several ales I've never tasted before ( De Molen and Mikkeller) and they was awesome!

JQRACOrpHC3TyHCDcBnPuQ.text: Five stars for the amazing range of beer they have available both on tap and in bottles. The staff are knowledgable and friendly and the place has a great atmosphere. The decoration is minimal so you couldn't call it cosy, but it's a great place to try out some new beers.

XmYYskWyY02w5oCsv-Yp4Q.text: An absolutely lovely pub near Victoria that specialises in real ale- mainly English, German and Belgian, both on tap and in bottles. I wish I could've spent more time here but I had a meeting to go to, otherwise I could've spent hours in here. There's extremely friendly service, in a spacious and comfortable interior. You can chat to the landlord about the beer and get beers recommended to you. There's a good range of beers- not an exhaustive range but a variety that puts most London pubs to shame. The beer's not cheap, but you pay for quality. There's a limited and straightforward food menu, which I didn't try. (After a quick Google it seems that this pub was formerly known as the Pimlico Tram and was rebranded in 2008.)

SO4kpIo2yl_qLXKy7VSdYQ.text: One of my favorite London pubs. The tap/cask selection is great. The best beer I've had herewas the BrewDog I Hardcore You. Awesome. There is a huge bottle list but these beers tend to be on the pricey side. The draught stuff is reasonably priced, though. The food looks good and is also a bit pricey; I haven't had any. A very clean, sleek bar with lots of tables inside and a few out. Overall a great place to get some good beers.

mFv58RdS2Wy3zYuImNgFsw.text: A place for beer lovers and just plain lovers. The atmosphere is romantic with candle's placed in the windows. You really wouldn't notice if you just want a beer but if your enjoying a pint with a love one it makes for some great pictures. Had the duck and it was good. Not great but good.

hefsX9TSFQECxzGy__mtIg.text: A beer drinker's dream come true. I can't think of many pubs that could compete with the sheer range and quality of beers on offer, both bottled and draft, and with the relaxed and modern surroundings. I could happily while away the evening of one of my increasing rare visits to London here just reading and re-reading  the beer menu.

P1nBoZWShr1IGK7AQfcfKA.text: What an absolutely brilliant place and well worth the short walk from either Pimlico or Victoria station if you're in the area. I've not yet tried the food but my friends that have always seem to enjoy themselves. There are always new and exciting beers available there and the staff are more than happy to let you try before you buy. Talking of the staff, they're absolutely superb and no matter how busy Cask gets, they're always happy to help and I've never received anything other than service with a smile there. I discovered it about a year ago and have been going infrequently ever since.

UZ2YPWVZzmDhQQu8q4IOBg.text: I came here on a recommendation from a beer-enthusiast/nascent pub proprietor while we were both drinking at Euston Tap. The Cask Pub and Kitchen is on a quiet street in Pimlico. The atmosphere seems a classic pub atmosphere that manages to avoid feeling totally generic. There's ample seating, from small tables to stools. I went on a Thursday evening and it was bustling, but not packed, and the clientele was mixed:  everyone from business professionals still in their suits to a younger and snappier crowd, plus a group of what looked to be some serious ale-drinkers. The beer selection is incredible. Their printed "menu" is more like a book, and with five tall refrigerators full of bottles and eleven (if I remember correctly) beers on draught it is no surprise that The Cask Pub is a beer-lover's kind of place. They do, however, also have a full bar serving liquors. I think five of the draught ales were BrewDog and three were Dark Star. Most of the rest were some wild looking German beers, too. I had two guest ales by Dark Star:  the Six Hop Ale and the Sussex Extra Stout, and was pleased by both. The Six Hop Ale is a stiff beer:  tons of hops dominate the flavors while enough malt is there to serve as a reference point. 6.5% ABV doesn't hurt either. According to Dark Star's website, it's February's monthly special, so get to The Cask and get it while you can. I think most of their ales rotate fairly regularly. My ale was reasonably-priced at £3.40 per pint, a price that it hurts me to say I once paid for a pint of Red Stripe in a shitty club in Shoreditch. Oh, and the chips were good, too. And the music was inoffensive.£10 minimum for cards.
